channel.title: Benjy School Notes
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Benjy School Notes

item.description: Quote Explosions "Swanage huddled against a rocky headland" Personification The use of the word rocky contrasts with huddles huddles makes it seem cosy and home-like Swanage sounds like a small village, possibly near the sea because rocks.

item.title: Exam Guide
item.description: 3 hours, 100 marks total A: 1 hours, 40 marks B: 1 hours, 30 marks C: 1 hours, 30 marks Section A Answer all questions --- Text 1 --- Question 1 [1] Identify one way that the writer… One short quote Question 2 [1] In lines xx-xx the writer suggests ways that people… State one of them.

item.title: Sound types
item.description: 1. Manners of Articulation (Consonant Types) These describe how the airflow is modified. A.

item.title: 64a
item.description: Solving linear simultaneous equations by elimination Prepare the equations Rearrange both into the format ax \space \pm \space by = c Make one of the terms in the equation the same by multiplying entire equations.

item.title: 66a
item.description: Simplifying expressions by applying index laws more than once or to several terms Indices Rules.

item.title: 78a
item.description: Finding the nth term of a quadratic sequence Here is a sequence: \big\{10, 21, 36, 55, 78\big\} Calculate the differences: \begin{matrix}10, 21, 36, 55, 78 \\ 11, 15, 19, 23\end{matrix} The difference is not constant so we have an n^2 term.

item.title: 80a
item.description: Factorise quadratic expressions with a non unitary coefficient of x² medium.

item.title: 66n
item.description: Writing a change as a percentage Calculate change devide my m_1 times by 100 for percentage Calculate the profit/loss by subtracting the original price (m_1) from the final price (m_2) m_2-m_1 = p £139750 - £125000 = £14750 Next, divide the profit (p) by the original price (m_1) \frac{p}{m_{1}} = x ...

item.title: 82n
item.description: Simplifying surds by taking out square factors Express \sqrt3 + \sqrt{ 12 } in the form a\sqrt{ 3 } where a is an integer Key is to remember that \sqrt{ 12 } = \sqrt{ 3 } + \sqrt{ 4 } memory.
